intro: Weberbauera lagunae, commonly known as the Laguna Weberbauera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
